page.title: 10A Lady's Life in Calbourne
page.content: As{MIDDLE AGED WOMEN}living in the village of Calbourne, we find village life very active with a good communtiy spirit. Most people have the use of a car and many women can drive as well as men. Heating is by Electricity, Solid fuel or Calor gas. Most women have labour saving homes, the majority have the telephone, television and electrical appliances to aid with cleaning and cooking. So with more free time many women are involved in local activities, fund raising for the Church, Womens Institute and Recreation Centre. Many women who work outside the home do Part time. The bus service is two hourly to nearest town. Most women visit Town once a week for shopping, occasionally they cross to the mainland. Hobbies and leisure activities include sewing, knitting, walking and flower arranging
